p: The prevalence of SDRMs in recent infections was 2.4% in 2015, which was not significantly higher than that in 2014 (1.8%, χ 2 = 0.263, p = 0.791) [ 37]. However, we found that the prevalence of TDR increased with age. In the group that was above 50 years of age, the prevalence of TDR was over 5% and reached a moderate level, which should be considered. To control HIV-1 TDR, a priority is to strengthen the standard management of patients and regularly perform drug resistance surveillance.
